column2: SOUTH DAKOTA DMV WRITTEN TEST
column4: South Dakota

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. If you've had a few beers, the effects of alcohol will be reduced only by:
column4: waiting several hours.
column8: taking a cold shower.

column2: 2. Which of the following substances can affect the ability to drive?
column4: Cold tablets containing codeine or antihistamines.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 3. When entering a freeway, you should check traffic by:
column4: using both the inside and outside mirrors.
column8: using the side mirror and looking over your shoulder.

column2: 4. This road sign means:
column4: Curves ahead
column8: Divided highway ahead

column2: 5. This road sign means:
column4: Drivers cannot make a complete turn to go in the opposite direction.
column6: Left turns are not allowed where this sign is displayed.
column8: Vehicles turning left must make a U-turn.

column2: 6. When is it safe to pass another vehicle?
column4: When you are entering a curve and there are no oncoming vehicles.
column6: When you are driving through an intersection and there are no oncoming vehicles.
column8: Whenever signs and/or markings permit passing other vehicles.

column2: 7. What should drivers do in case of a brake failure?
column4: Shift to a lower gear.
column8: Tie a white cloth on the left door handle.

column2: 8. Before making a left turn from a one-way street, you must:
column4: be in the lane closest to the right curb.
column6: be in the lane closest to the left curb.
column8: be in the lane closest to the center of the street.

column2: 9. If your brakes are wet, you can dry them by:
column4: having them checked by a mechanic.
column8: pull over to the right and wait until it stops raining.

column2: 10. When an aggressive driver confronts you, you should:
column4: Remain calm and relaxed.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 11. You are driving at night, and a vehicle comes toward you with their high beam headlights on. You should:
column4: look in the direction of the vehicle.
column8: flash your headlights once quickly.

column2: 12. Regulatory signs are:
column4: Suggestions
column8: Warnings

column2: 13. This road sign means:
column4: Work work ahead
column8: Slippery when wet

column2: 14. A thumping sound can be a warning:
column4: that a tire blowout is about to occur.
column8: of a brake failure.

column2: 15. When driving in work zones, drivers should:
column4: keep a safe following distance.
column6: pass the vehicle ahead when safe.
column8: tailgate the vehicle ahead while reducing their speed.

column2: 16. When driving on gravel roads:
column4: you should keep your eyes moving.
column6: your tires do not have as much traction.
column8: you should use cruise control to increase traction.

column2: 17. This road sign means:
column4: You must come to a complete stop
column8: Drive with caution and be ready to stop

column2: 18. When driving on the freeway behind large trucks, you should:
column4: drive closer behind the truck than for a passenger vehicle.
column8: move to the right of the truck and pass it quickly.

column2: 19. Diamond-shaped signs:
column4: indicate no pass zones.
column8: are used to warn of hazards on roadways.

column2: 20. Double solid lines on the roadway mean:
column4: you can not go across the lines except to turn left to enter or leave the highway.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 21. Roads with double solid yellow lines in the center indicate that passing is:
column4: not allowed in either direction.
column6: allowed only in your direction of travel.
column8: allowed in both directions.

column2: 22. This road sign warns drivers that:
column4: the one-way street or roadway is about to change to two-way traffic.
column8: they are coming to a point where another traffic lane joins the one they are on.

column2: 23. A driver who approaches an intersection:
column4: must yield the right-of-way to traffic already in the intersection.
column6: must drive straight through the intersection, even if another vehicle is already in the intersection.
column8: has the right-of-way over traffic already in the intersection.

column2: 24. It is legal to make a left turn at a red light after stopping if:
column4: you are traveling on a one-way street and turning onto another one-way street.
column6: you yield to all other traffic at the intersection before proceeding.
column8: you are traveling on a two-way street and turning onto a two-way street.

column2: 25. As you enter a roundabout you should slow down and:
column4: yield to any vehicle coming from your left in the roundabout.
column6: yield to pedestrians and bicyclist crossing before entering the roundabout.
column8: All of the above.
